results.title: Becoming aboriginal
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An exploration of the traditional education of tribal children in the aboriginal family. The same children are seen later in a formal classroom situation at Bamyili in the Northern Territory. To “become Aboriginal” these children must learn to survive in the bush, but also they must learn to survive in a world of European skills and values. Photographer: Andrew Fraser; Narrator: Gerry Bostock.

results.title: Becky
results.brief_description: This is the story of a retarded child and how her parents and others cope and learn from each other. Special ways of training at home and school are shown and the possible need for specialised medical care is touched upon. Such children can emerge from the special treatment area and enter normal life. This poignant and yet cheerful family portrait tells us how one family successfully copes with having their child at home. No other credits available.

results.title: The Beckoning sea
results.creator_credit: Stephen Kabak and University of California, Los Angeles. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A capsule resume of the forces that a young man feels are oppressing him. Taken from an experimental collection of stories entitled “The Beat Generation and the Angry Young Men”. Short story writer: George Mandel.

results.title: Beaver dam
results.creator_credit: F.R. Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film for children, one of its greatest appeal is watching the beaver at work, busily and cheerfully demonstrating the characteristics for which it is famous. Sometimes, however, a beaver’s industry runs counter to the plans of people. When the beaver’s dam floods their father’s hay field, two boys quickly devise a plan to save the beaver from their father’s displeasure.

results.title: The Beaver
results.creator_credit: John A. Haeseler, William H. Carr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Highlights activities of the beaver in its natural environment. Illustrates ways in which the beaver’s teeth, feet, and tail help him in swimming, eating, felling trees, and repairing a broken dam. Reveals the unique construction of a beaver house, and stresses the importance of the animal as an agent of conservation and as a valuable fur bearer.

results.title: Beautiful Lennard Island
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Steven Thomas Holland, age ten, is the son of a lighthouse-keeper who mans Lennard Island, a tiny place west of Vancouver Island. There is a population of four: mother, father and brother David. A gracious host and articulate fan of his beautiful island home, he takes us on a tour and dispels any ideas we might have that living in isolation is boring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Beauty of effort = La Beaute de l'effort
results.creator_credit: Marc de Gastyne, Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim and Natfilm
results.brief_description: Modern athletes movements are demonstrated in slow motion to illustrate the beauty of athletic sports, their special forms, their grace and their power. Tours French training centres for physical education instructors at Antibes, Joinville, Bordeaux and Poitiers. French language - no subtitles.

results.title: Beaten metalwork, seaming: making a child's mug
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
This film shows the making of a child’s mug right through from the sheet metal to the finished article and gives an opportunity for a number of craft operations to be observed; the design on paper, transference to metal sheet decoration, stages in forming the body of the mug, by bending, seaming, beating, and planishing. The base and the handle are seen being fashioned and joined to the body by brazing. Finally the cleaning up and polishing are shown.

results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.
